page.title: 09Paxhill Twyning
page.content: Paxhill is an area of new houses and bungalows built over the past 20 years. Different builders were employed so there is a variety of architecture. The occupants have varied jobs the majority being employed locally in Tewkesbury, Worcester, Cheltenham and Gloucester. Some are retired couples, others young families who are first time buyers. On the other side of Paxhill there are a number of much newer council houses, built within the last 10 years. Most of these house senior citizens occupying 2 bedroom accommodation. Further down the lane are some older council houses built about 30 years ago, some of which still have there original occupants. Behind them lie even more council property built about 50 years ago. Some are now privately owned.
